duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise, direct, and review results through the planning, fieldwork, and 'wrap-up' stages of an audit client engagement.
Market, network, and develop business within an area of expertise, ensuring engagement profitability involving billings and collections.
Advise clients on economic and regulatory risks within their industry, resolving complex accounting issues, and applying GAAP and GAAS consistently within complex situations.
Validate and assess the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, and communicate suggestions to improve client internal controls and accounting procedures.
Review SEC filings, including MD&A, financial statements, and disclosures for appropriateness in form, content, completeness, and accuracy.
Supervise Associates and Senior Associates, review their work, provide performance feedback, and act as a career advisor.
Conduct research projects, draw conclusions based on appropriate research, and prepare memos supporting research and conclusions.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Statistics (Master’s preferred)

Active CPA license or recognized equivalent (required). If active international equivalent, must obtain an active US CPA license within an approved timeframe as defined by firm licensing requirement guidelines.
